subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 29 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Allardyce resigns as Bolton boss
Sam Allardyce has stepped down as manager of Bolton with immediate effect.



 
Birmingham & Sunderland promoted
Derby's defeat by Crystal Palace confirms Birmingham and Sunderland's promotion to the Premiership.



 
Arsenal 3-1 Fulham
Fulham remain a point above the Premiership relegation zone after losing out to two late Arsenal goals.








GOLF




Schwartzel claims title in Madrid
English duo Simon Dyson and Mark Foster have to settle for joint-fourth as South African Charl Schwartzel wins the Spanish Open in Madrid.



 
Byron Nelson leaderboard
Leading scores from the Byron Nelson Championship.



 
Donald clings on to lead in Texas
Britain's Luke Donald retains his one-shot lead after the third round of the Byron Nelson Championship.








MOTORSPORT




Toseland extends lead in Holland
James Toseland stretches his World Superbikes championship lead with a win and second place at the Dutch Grand Prix.



 
Button 'wants to stay at Honda'
Jenson Button has no plans to leave struggling F1 team Honda, according to his manager.



 
Toyota team boss will stand down
Toyota team boss Tsutomu Tomita will stand down at the end of June and be replaced by Tadashi Yamashina.








FORMULA ONE




Button 'wants to stay at Honda'
Jenson Button has no plans to leave struggling F1 team Honda, according to his manager.



 
Toyota team boss will stand down
Toyota team boss Tsutomu Tomita will stand down at the end of June and be replaced by Tadashi Yamashina.



 
Raikkonen urged to get technical
Kimi Raikkonen's former team boss hints the Finn could be even better if he paid more attention to his role outside the car.








ATHLETICS




Radcliffe not in GB marathon team
GB's marathon team for the World Athletics Championships is named but does not include Paula Radcliffe at this stage.



 
Yamauchi voices Osaka heat fears
Mara Yamauchi warns conditions in Osaka at the World Athletics Championships will be even tougher than during the London Marathon.



 
Runner dies after London Marathon
A 22-year-old runner who was taken ill after completing the London Marathon dies in hospital.








CYCLING




Wiggins welcomes Basso suspension
British star Bradley Wiggins says the decision to suspend Ivan Basso is "good news for cycling".



 
Cooke misses out on Belgian win
Nicole Cooke loses out to main rival Marianne Vos in the Belgian stage of the World Cup, the Fleche Wallonne.



 
Tour of Britain route is revealed
Organisers unveil the route for this year's Tour of Britain, which will begin in London on Sunday, 9 September.








FUN AND GAMES




Holloway column
"Alan Ball threw me the keys to his Merc and said: 'Come on, find us a caff'"



 
Review of the week
Mourinho comes out of the laundry basket and says what he thinks



 
Comment: Rooney steals the show
Robbo says Wayne Rooney turned in the display of the week
